column4: Anyone had trouble with Audacity closing down when clicking the record button?
Ironman1::
Ironman1:: Sorry bout that...it is a file permissions problem that you have to correct with umask in your fsab file..I assume the external drive is ntfs/fat32?
Ironman1:: I meant *fstab*
edueb:: What happens when you alt-tab?
i can scroll between the apps
but i want to see the apps on the panel
edueb:: I understand...however I have never felt a need to delve into how to change the default way the panel is setup..sorry
ok. do you think that erasing the gnome conf i can solve the problem?
edueb:: Probably an unwise choice..I would see the config file itself in your home folder and see if there is any comments in there on how to change the panel
i know but i'm quite new on ubuntu and i don't know where to put my hands
edueb:: Well that is ok everyone starts somewhere...I would suggest google or ubuntuforum.org to search and see if anyone(more than likely) has wanted to make the change as you do
Ironman1:: Or sudo -i
thank you for the help ;)
edueb:: No problem..BTW I did look in my own hidden directory you have to issue ls -al in a folder to see them..they are prefixed with a period..therefore hidden
edueb:: There was nothing in there that looked like a config file...usally end in .conf  .... so it is more than likely in a different directory path
yes i'm using nautilus with hidden files enabled. i'll try to make a copy of the dir and than delete the original
edueb:: All that will do is to recreate what you already have there I believe
but it should recreate with default settings
Hey Dr_willis
We are talking Gnome here no? Yes you are correct
yes gnome 2.20
